questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: JavaScript has Number, but not a separate Float type.

questions.text: Which symbol is used for single-line comments in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Single-line comments in JavaScript use //.

questions.text: What will '2' + 2 evaluate to in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The + operator concatenates when one operand is a string.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to declare a constant in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: const declares a block-scoped constant variable.

questions.text: Which function converts a JSON string into an object?
questions.explanation: JSON.parse() converts JSON string to an object.

questions.text: Which keyword is used for asynchronous functions?
questions.explanation: async defines a function as asynchronous.

questions.text: Which operator is used to check both value and type?
questions.explanation: === checks both value and type.

questions.text: Which method adds an element to the end of an array?
questions.explanation: push() adds one or more elements at the end of an array.

questions.text: Which method removes the last element of an array?
questions.explanation: pop() removes the last element of an array.

questions.text: Which method joins all elements of an array into a string?
questions.explanation: join() concatenates all array elements into a string.

questions.text: Which function is used to print messages to the console?
questions.explanation: console.log() is used to log messages to the console.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to exit a loop?
questions.explanation: break terminates the loop immediately.

questions.text: Which function is used to delay execution of code?
questions.explanation: setTimeout() delays execution of a function.

questions.text: What will typeof NaN return?
questions.explanation: NaN is of type number in JavaScript.

questions.text: Which operator is used to spread elements of an array?
questions.explanation: The spread operator ... expands array elements.

questions.text: Which object represents the global scope in browsers?
questions.explanation: window is the global scope object in browsers.

questions.text: Which function runs code repeatedly with a fixed time delay?
questions.explanation: setInterval() executes code repeatedly with delay.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to handle errors in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript uses try...catch for error handling.

questions.text: Which statement creates a block-scoped variable?
questions.explanation: let and const create block-scoped variables.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to define a class in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript uses the 'class' keyword.
